message.content:
cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.NE, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the synchronization of automata, which is a topic in discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and formal languages (cs.FL). The probabilistic analysis of synchronization is a common technique in randomized algorithms (cs.RA) and the paper uses probabilistic arguments to prove its main result. The Cerny conjecture is a well-known problem in theoretical computer science (cs.THE) and the paper provides a new result related to this conjecture. Finally, the paper deals with the synchronization of systems, which is a topic in control theory (cs.SY) and optimization (cs.NE).
